channel.title: Summary :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: In this chapter, we exported the idea of routes, a mechanism for mapping a request to the appropriate endpoint function to generate a response. Routes typically consist of both the request URL and the request method. RESTful routes provide a common strategy for implementing CRUD methods for a server-generated resource; any programmer familiar with REST will quickly be able to suss out the appropriate route. We also explored routers are objects that make routing more manageable to implement.
